column4: is it possible to generate a xorg.conf-file from a running xserver with a ubuntu livecd???
the one in /etc/ looks really sparse, it has no config-options!
what are you trying to achieve ?
i have an intel GMA965 chipset which runs better under ubuntu, so i would like to know, which options ubuntu uses, but /etc/X11/xorg.conf is really sparse and desn't contain further information
better under ubuntu as in .. even in the live cd .. ?
actually im using archlinux, and the gfx-performance under ubuntu is better (glxgears 250 vs. 600 fps)
ok .. so when you are running the live cd .. the file in /etc/X11/xorg.conf is the file that is being used...
there are NO config options per se .. its just the correct driver
so just copy the file to your archlinux's xorg.conf and run arch
hmk, so perhaps i have too much options on, which turns down performance ...
I am saying .. save a backup .. copy ubuntu''s xorg.conf over your arch's version and run arch
i'll give it a try, thx
